description: Primer on digital audio. Overview of signal processing, sampling, compression, human psychoacoustics, MP3, intellectual property, hardware and software platform components, and networking (i.e., the basic technical underpinnings of modern MP3 players and cell phones).
name: DIG AUDIO BASICS

values.comments: The lab gives an overview of signal processing, sampling, compression, human psychoacoustics, MP3, intellectual property, hardware and software platform components, and networking (i.e., the basic technical underpinnings of modern MP3 players and cell phones).  Students generally remarked that the labs were “well thought-out” but did not execute well and often ran into technical and timing issues. Many also noted a large disconnect between course lectures and lab material. Some noted that the lectures offered interesting materials that merely “serve as ‘pointers’ to other courses”, and the labs lacked a sense of direction.   Students generally described Professor Koditschek as “very enthusiastic.”   One student recommended this course to freshmen and sophomores, but said that the material was too easy to challenge a junior or senior. One intro programming course is a prerequisite.
